looks good (or bad depending on your perspective)...sorry for the badly formatted stack trace...

Fixed.

This happens when initializing the viewer with a new model. The input changes, which creates a new model, which gets initialized, and can call back to the view (in this case to expand an element), but the viewer has no model yet (it's being created/initialized).

Fix seperates creation of model from initialization. Callback happens after model has been set in the viewer.

Changes to

AsynchronousModel.java
AsynchronousModelViewer.java
AsynchronousTreeModel.java
AsynchronousTreeModelViewer.java
*** Bug 126885 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Does this affect the usability of the i-build?
I worked with yesterdays I build all day and did not see this problem.
